item.title: [GRATUIT] Thingiverse > craftlogictv > Basic_Shingle_Textured_Rolling_Pin [non dl]
item.description:
Source : https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4304537

Id objet : 4304537

Prix : 0 euros

Collections :

  • DIVERS Matériel de Modélisme

Collections pour tags :

  • DIVERS Matériel de Modélisme NONDL NONSUP

Description :

1
2
3
4
5
6
7

This is the shingle texture roller that I demonstrated on the Craft Logic YouTube channel. This is a technique I am experimenting with for making good looking shingles much more quickly than cutting and gluing individual pieces. This is still a work in progress. I have printed a very similar roller successfully but have since made changes and this version has not be printed. The first version was printed on my Ender 3 without any issues and without supports. The changes I made are fairly minimal so I expect this will print just fine as well. I have linked to the demonstration video on my channel, but, to be honest, it isn't the best example of what the roller can do. I have also included a picture of another test piece that has much better results in my opinion. I will keep experimenting, but I'd also love to get feedback on the roller if you decide to print and use it! Let me know what you think!

Let me know what you think! If you like the design, please check out and consider subscribing to my YouTube channel, https://www.youtube.com/c/CraftLogic and follow me on Instagram @craftlogictv.

If you really like the model, and are feeling generous, please consider a tip! It really helps to support the channel!

Thanks!

item.title: [GRATUIT] Thingiverse > craftlogictv > Cobblestone_Texture_Roller [non dl]
item.description:

Collections :

  • DIVERS Matériel de Modélisme

Collections pour tags :

  • DIVERS Matériel de Modélisme NONDL NONSUP

Description :

1
2
3
4
5
6
7

This is the cobblestone roller that I designed on my YouTube channel. I've had several requests for this roller, so here it is! I have successfully printed this on my Elegoo Mars with supports on the bottom just to increase the surface area on the build plate. A raft would likely work just as well. I have not tried printing on an FDM printer but I imagine it will need more supports for that. I'd love to know how it turns out if anyone tries to print on FDM. I've included some pictures of a model I build that utilized this roller so you can see how it turns out when used in a project. I hope you find it useful!

Let me know what you think! If you like the design, please check out and consider subscribing to my YouTube channel, https://www.youtube.com/c/CraftLogic and follow me on Instagram @craftlogictv.

If you really like the model, and are feeling generous, please consider a tip! It really helps to support the channel!

Thanks!
